xxl.core.util
Class Arrays

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.util.Arrays

public class Arrays
extends java.lang.Object

The class Arrays contains methods which are concerned with arrays of primitive Java types.

Field Summary

          Hex chars inside an array.

newBooleanArray

public static boolean[] newBooleanArray(int size,
                                        boolean initValue)
Returns a new boolean array that is initialized according to the parameters. This method is useful especially in the relationalNEU package.

Parameters:
size - size of the array.
initValue - value that all boolean values get.
Returns:
returns a new boolean array

newIntArray

public static int[] newIntArray(int size,
                                java.util.Iterator iterator)
Returns a new int array that is initialized according to the iterator.

Parameters:
size - size of the array.
iterator - Iterator containing the initialization int-values. The iterator should contain exactly size elements. If that is not true, then 0s are added (or the rest of the iterator may not be traversed).
Returns:
returns a new int array

                             int fromIndex,

Parameters:

fromIndex - the index of the first element (inclusive) to be copied.
toIndex - the index of the last element (exclusive) to be copied.
Returns:
returns a new array created

remove

public static byte[] remove(byte[] array,
                            int fromIndex,
                            int toIndex,
                            boolean shrink)
Removes a part of a byte array and returns the resulting array. The size of the array depends on the shrink-Parameter.

Parameters:
array - byte array.
fromIndex - the index of the first element (inclusive) to be removed.
toIndex - the index of the last element (exclusive) to be removed.
shrink - determines if the returned array has length array.length-(toIndex-fromIndex) (shrink==true) or array.length (shrink==false).
Returns:
returns the resulting array

remove

public static int[] remove(int[] array,
                           int fromIndex,
                           int toIndex,
                           boolean shrink)
Removes a part of a int array and returns the resulting array. The size of the array depends on the shrink-Parameter.

Parameters:
array - int array.
fromIndex - the index of the first element (inclusive) to be removed.
toIndex - the index of the last element (exclusive) to be removed.
shrink - determines if the returned array has length array.length-(toIndex-fromIndex) (shrink==true) or array.length (shrink==false).
Returns:
returns the resulting array

                                          int offset,
                                          int size)
Returns a hashcode for a byte array. This mus be efficient, but return many different values.

Parameters:
b - byte array
offset - start of the valid part of the array
size - size of the valid part inside the array
Returns:
a hash code

printHexArray

public static void printHexArray(byte[] arr,
                                 java.io.PrintStream out)
Print the array as a chain of hex numbers the start line number will be zero.

Parameters:
arr - byte array
out - PrintStream to which the representation of the array is written.

printHexArray

public static void printHexArray(byte[] arr,
                                 long lineNum,
                                 java.io.PrintStream out)
Print the given byte array as a chain of hex numbers. You can specify a line number so that the chain is numbered.

Parameters:
arr - byte array
lineNum - Number of the first output line.
out - PrintStream to which the representation of the array is written.

arr - byte array
Returns:
hexadecimal representation

                                                   long lineNum)
Print the given byte array as a chain of hex numbers to a String. You can specifie a line number so that the chain is numbered.

Parameters:
arr - byte array
lineNum - the line numbler
Returns:
hexadecimal representation

arrayToCursor

public static Cursor arrayToCursor(java.lang.Object[] array)
The elements from array[0] to array[array.length-1] will be returned by this cursor. A new Enumerator(array.length) lets the elements be returned in the same order as they are contained in the given object array.

Parameters:
array - the object array delivering the elements.
Returns:
a cursor delivering the elements backed on the given array.

arrayToCursor

public static Cursor arrayToCursor(java.lang.Object[] array,
                                   int begin,
                                   int end)
The elements from array[begin] to array[end-1] will be returned by this cursor. A new Enumerator(array.length) lets the elements be returned in the same order as they are contained in the given object array.

Parameters:
array - the object array delivering the elements.
begin - index to start
end - index to stop (exclusive)
Returns:
a cursor delivering a subset of the elements backed on the given array.

arrayToCursor

public static Cursor arrayToCursor(java.lang.Object[] array,
                                   java.util.Iterator indices)
The elements from array[0] to array[array.length-1] will be returned by this cursor.

Parameters:
array - the object array delivering the elements.
indices - iterator of indices; the indices of this iterator define the order the elements will be returned by the cursor.
Returns:
a cursor delivering the elements backed on the given array and the defined order.

byteArrayOutputStream

public java.io.OutputStream byteArrayOutputStream(byte[] content,
                                                  int base,
                                                  int end)
Wrapps a byte array to an outputstream. A call of the write() method on the returned outputStream inserts a byte into the array. With every call of the write() method the insert-position of enclosed array will be increased by one.

Parameters:
content - the byte array
base - the position in the array where to start writing
end - the position in the array where to stop writing
Returns:
OutputStream created

indexOf

public static int indexOf(java.lang.Object[] array,
                          java.lang.Object element)
Returns the index in the specified array of the first occurrence of the specified element, or -1 if the array does not contain this element. More formally, returns the lowest index i such that (element == null ? array[i] == null : element.equals(array[i])), or -1 if there is no such index.

Parameters:
array - the array to be searched.
element - the element to search for.
Returns:
the index in the array of the first occurrence of the specified element, or -1 if the array does not contain this element.

min

public static int min(java.lang.Object[] array,
                      java.util.Comparator comparator)
Returns the array index with the smallest element using a given comparator.

Parameters:
array - The array to be searched.
comparator - The comparator to compare two elements of the array.
Returns:
The index in the array of the smallest element or -1 if the array does not have elements.

max

public static int max(java.lang.Object[] array,
                      java.util.Comparator comparator)
Returns the array index with the biggest element using a given comparator.

Parameters:
array - The array to be searched.
comparator - The comparator to compare two elements of the array.
Returns:
The index in the array of the biggest element or -1 if the array does not have elements.

enumeratedIntArray

public static int[] enumeratedIntArray(int from,
                                       int to)
Returns an array containing an ascending sequence of int values within the specified range [from;to].

Parameters:
from - the start of the returned int value sequence (inclusive).
to - the end of the returned int value sequence (exclusive).
Returns:
an array containing an ascending sequence of int values within the specified range [from;to].

incrementIntArray

public static int[] incrementIntArray(int[] array,
                                      int increment)
Increments every column of the given array by the given increment and returns it.

Parameters:
array - the array holding the int values to be incremented.
increment - the value the array's columns are increased by.
Returns:
an array containing the incremented values of the given array.

decrementIntArray

public static int[] decrementIntArray(int[] array,
                                      int decrement)
Decrements every column of the given array by the given decrement and returns it.

Parameters:
array - the array holding the int values to be decremented.
decrement - the value the array's columns are decreased by.
Returns:
an array containing the decremented values of the given array.
